description:
Lightning is a bit of a stretch from Astroimaging, but in my defense Jupiter did pop out on the right a few frames later.

The storm was little more than 10 miles away but was completely silent - the dividing line of the clouds was right over my head, and the northern sky was completely clear. I wish I had a large mirror with me, I could have gotten stars trails from the reflected ground and lightning to the south.

Edit: Looks like the aquisition details don't show up when you select "other." This is a stack of a half dozen 120" exposures taken at ISO 200, 18mm, and F/11 using a Canon 450D and a kit 18-55mm lens
title: Lightning over Wichita, KS on June 14, 2017
